channel.title: "History Log" feature
channel.description:
_I understand this feature has been suggested before, but I've read them, and I'm using greater detail_
Having little knowledge about how easy this feature would be to implement (clientside or serverside) it is my opinion that a somewhat detailed History of games be accessible in the Profile of a player (not a public history). _Some of this info could be similar to the End-game screen of each match._
Such a feature could include: * **Date:** (of match) * **Class played and Final Class** * **Faction:** (Blue Dragon / Unseen / Cult / Neutral / King) * **Number of Days / Nights in the match** * **Night survived until:** (if dead) * **Win or Lose:** (if goal is met, etc) * **Kills:** (if applicable) * **Heals:** (if applicable) * **x abilities used:** (for each class) * **Accusations:** (tally for successful and unsuccessful, depending on Faction) * **Successful predictions:** (Predictions of Night deaths and Executions from the graveyard screen)
I don't see why this kind of information can't be kept locally with the game's data, per player. The format would be exclusively text-based, so very low bytes storage. Also, it's not strictly important information, and as such, a malicious player falsifying the information doesn't particularly have any influence to the gameplay.
I believe that such a History Log would allow for ultimate bragging rights (if for someone potent at a particular Class), and also give players a suitable structure to their learning curve of the game.
I would thoroughly enjoy a feature like this, and I would love a History Log that I could share to my friends on the TOL Discord.
**Are there any other statistics that a History Log could contain?**
Thanks for reading.
